text: Mr Poody is always in a grump.
It’s our job to help cheer him up.
So what are you grumpy about today Mr Poody?
Oh I see.
You don’t like the rain.

Well at least you’re warm and snug inside
your house.
Oh dear.
It looks like you have a leak in your roof.
I think you need a bucket Mr Poody.
Where do you keep your bucket?
Oh!
Your bucket is outside in the shed?
Come on Mr Poody, let’s go outside.
The fresh air will do you good!
What’s wrong now Mr Poody?

Oh you’re sad because it’s cold and wet
outside.

There’s no such thing as bad weather, only
unsuitable clothing.

So let’s put on some nice warm clothes and
a coat.
WOW Mr Poody, you look as warm as toast.
Oh my.
What a beautiful garden Mr Poody.

You see rain isn’t that bad after all is
it?

You see when you’re thirsty; you turn on
your tap and pour yourself a glass of water
don’t you?

Well rain is a way for all the plants in your
garden to have something nice to drink so
that they can grow big and strong.

Let’s go and explore your vegetable patch
should we?
Don’t get angry Mr Poody.

The more water your vegetables drink, the
bigger they will get and that means more food
for you.
Look.
Well that’s going to be quite a feast.
I hope you’re hungry Mr Poody.
You had better use your umbrella Mr Poody.
Oh well done.
You’ve found your bucket.
Great work!
Look above you Mr Poody.
How amazing.

You see after there has been rain, there is
sometimes a colourful rainbow.
Isn’t it beautiful?
So you see.
Rain is definitely a good thing.
Everyone loves the rain don’t they?
It’s so much fun.
Why don’t you have a go?
Poor you Mr Poody.
It really hasn’t been your day has it?

Why don’t you make yourself a nice warm
cup of tea.

Did you know Mr Poody that like the plants
in your garden, our tap water also comes from
rainwater.
That’s right.

We get rain water from above and below the
ground which makes its way into rivers and

reservoirs and then into our taps for us to
drink.
Isn’t that amazing?
And the sun is also good for you too.
But don’t forget to put on your sun cream.
Oh dear Mr Poody.
Are you ok?

Did you know that Lightning is an electric
current...
